review_title: AMIGOS is a unique place to open up the world for young people while learning about non-profit management
pros:
- A young, fun, warm and talented staff. Staff members at all levels can ask for and take on more responsibility than in many work places.
- Entering its 50th year, the organization has recently gone through a lot of important changes that will make it much stronger moving forward
- The AMIGOS network is very wide and strong; makes for getting to know a lot of different people in many fields 
- Our approach to volunteering is driven by solidarity rather than charity and is truly community-driven, which is different than many other organizations in our space
- The work is dynamic, exciting and intense; these jobs are for people who are up for a challenge
cons:
- Internal systems were not updated for many years, so we are playing catch up
- Houston is not a hub for international youth, development or exchange work 
- Airfare out of Houston is expensive at the moment and may not go down for awhile 
- The building has a nice atmosphere but will not be adequate in the years to come 
- Work-life balance can be challenging to achieve on a consistent basis

review_title: Project Supervisor -Overwhelming amounts of work, incredibly rewarding, one of the best summer jobs for college students
pros: Great summer job for college students. You will get a ton of personal growth. You will meet really great intelligent, hard working, inspiring people. The job will be an adventure like no other. It's very exciting work. You can work closely with foreign governments officials. You get to take care of your own group of about 10 kids and watch them go through a lot of growth in 6 to 8 weeks. Everything is paid for.
cons: Overwhelming amounts of work, lack of sleep, not very high paying, lack of communication with "back home"

pros: An unforgettable and life changing experience. It's a great opportunity to spend some time in another country and to build deep relationships and go beyond visiting as a tourist. Spending time with community members and host families is lovely and the participants are also great to get to know. The professional experience is very valuable and my time as a PS helped me land my full-time job.
cons: Amigos staff are overworked with lots of tedious paperwork and participants can sometimes be difficult to deal with. I was constantly tired during my summer as a supervisor.
